body_html:
@peterbraden @danmane

I am not sure how this project is being managed, but in my opinion it would be best to merge this as a beta feature rather than closing, otherwise how would you ever get enough collaborators to try it out and contribute issues/fixes?

I would love to help and contribute, but not sure what are the gaps, so if you have some breakdown it would be helpful.

Perhaps contributing tests would be a good starting point?

BTW regarding https://github.com/feross/standard, while it is popular it's also very opinionated, so unless you feel very opinionated about specific coding style, you are probably better of using eslint with https://github.com/google/eslint-config-google as base which provides great starting point, and can be adapted to specific needs. But that's not something to stop from merging, and can be applied later as well.

body:
@peterbraden @danmane 

I am not sure how this project is being managed, but in my opinion it would be best to merge this as a beta feature rather than closing, otherwise how would you ever get enough collaborators to try it out and contribute issues/fixes?

I would love to help and contribute, but not sure what are the gaps, so if you have some breakdown it would be helpful.

Perhaps contributing tests would be a good starting point?

BTW regarding https://github.com/feross/standard, while it is popular it's also very opinionated, so unless you feel very opinionated about specific coding style, you are probably better of using eslint with https://github.com/google/eslint-config-google as base which provides great starting point, and can be adapted to specific needs. But that's not something to stop from merging, and can be applied later as well.
